name: Reijnders' Putsch
description: In an absolutely shocking turn of events, the head of the Dutch army, Izaak Reijnders launched a military coup d'Ã©tat in Amsterdam, stating that the nation was in danger of falling to dangerous syndicalist subversives. Holland's destiny is, for now, uncertain.

name: Intimidate Parliament
description: The new status quo cannot be guaranteed without Parliament being bullied into handing over emergency powers. Such measures might be unpleasant, but they are necessary to stave off syndicalist revolt.

name: Alliance of the Right
description: Holland's problems cannot be solved by one party alone. There must be unity in purpose between nationalists and conservatives if this nation is to be saved from the dangers of radical thinking.

name: VNH Electoral Victory
description: The VNH have won an astounding victory in the recent elections, supplanting the conservative CNA, and plunging the nation into uncertainty. What the new government will do is, yet, uncertain.

name: Consolidate the Junta
description: With the putsch having been a complete success, it is now incumbent on the powers that be to formalise their rule. By consolidating the members of the new provisional military junta in charge of the Netherlands, some much needed stability will be granted to a weary nation.

name: Declare Martial Law
description: If we are to safeguard the new regime then it is imperative that we begin crackdowns immediately and demonstrate our resolve to solve the nation's political crisis. By declaring martial law in Europe, we will be able to make clear our determination to save Holland from itself.

name: Dissolve the Landwacht
description: The Landwacht are aligned with VNH nationalist interests against the state, and so they must be put down - by force if necessary. The only paramilitaries that can be allowed to operate in Holland are our own.

name: The Queen's Speech
description: While Her Majesty has mostly sought to stay clear of politics in recent months, befitting her position and royal dignity, it has increasingly become clear that the new regime is here to stay and as such it appears that she may soon publicly announce her tacit support for it, at least for the moment.

name: Exploit Royalist Sentiment
description: With the Queen's backing, our junta has been given the modicum of legitimacy that it needed to bring a number of undecided moderates over to our way of thinking. Now increasingly viewed as the saviours of a troubled nation, our position is becoming far safer.

name: The Order of Oranje Nassau
description: The chivalric Order of Orange-Nassau exists to reward those that give their all to the Dutch people, either on the battlefield or in the civilian sphere. With the support of the monarchy, we can begin to use the order for our own political and military ends.

name: Establish Secret Police
description: The current state security apparatus is insufficient for our needs, that much is clear. By establishing an entirely new branch of the police, linked with intelligence and military divisions, we can help preserve Holland's stability.

name: VNH Crackdown
description: While the Landwacht has been suppressed, its insidious paymasters in the VNH still remain active in the country. It is not only leftist groups that pose a threat to our country, but nationalist groups too.

name: Permanent Stability
description: It has become clear to all that there is no way that the people can be left to their own devices. Inevitably populist figures on the left and right will rise to hijack their passions and fears, plunging the nation into chaos. There is only one rational path forwards - an end to elections.

name: Restore Democracy
description: The dangers of syndicalism and populism have been averted. There is no more need for a reactionary junta and the time has come to restore democratic rule to the Netherlands.

name: Rebuild the Binnenhof
description: The Binnenhof is a near-sacred institution in the Netherlands, and the arson that destroyed it to many represents a clear symbol of the decay of our state and its slide into political madness. By rebuilding it we might send a widespread signal of what we hope to achieve for the future.

name: Syndicalist Crackdown
description: Our nation has allowed those that seek to do it harm to wander its streets unmolested for years. This sad situation must end if we are to preserve the independence of Holland in the face of despicable Red forces arrayed against us in the south and west.

name: Papua Camps
description: By establishing new prison camps on distant Papua in our East Indies colonies, we shall have a place to which we can banish all syndicalists that pose a threat to the nation. Nobody would foolish enough to try to escape on an island filled with cannibals and man-eating creatures, after all.

name: The Red Scare
description: The threat that the forces of socialism and treacherous syndicalism poses to our way of life cannot be underestimated. It is time that we begin making this clear to the people, if they have not already grasped a fact as basic and immutable as gravity itself.

name: Break up the Socialist Pillar
description: While the Socialist pillar has until now been a mostly tolerable focal point for more legitimate and less violent dissent against conservative rule of Holland, it poses a threat that goes far beyond the sum of its parts. The institutions such as the trade unions could hide syndicalist sympathisers, and this is intolerable.

name: Attempt to Legitimise the Landwacht
description: The Landwacht has an image problem, that much is obvious. However, if we attempt to portray them as citizen guards and drill that message into the populace enough, it may just be enough to cover up their glaring flaws. Reforming them as an organisation will have to come later.

name: Zonderlinge Zaterdag
description: VNH's reforms have been effective so far, and the country is recovering to some extent, both politically and economically. All the same, the events of 'Strange Saturday' might put an end to all previous notions of stability.

name: Van Geelkerken's Arrest
description: With the failure of Van Geelkerken in his attempt to force the retirement of Swart, it is important that we seek to make as much political capital out of this as possible. By crushing a hard-line coup, our own moderate credentials have been burnished and our popularity has reached new heights.

name: Reform the Landwacht
description: The Landwacht has been incredibly effective in securing and defending our government. Unfortunately, it has several unsavoury elements within it that have cast a poor light on the rest of the paramilitary force as well as our own government. Things must change.

name: The Dutch Stratocracy
description: We have saved the Netherlands from the abyss, and for that we should feel nothing but total elation. Unfortunately, peace is fleeting, and as such as we must set about linking government control with that of the military. Together, military and state will preserve the nation's greatness.

name: Swart's Retirement
description: Van Geelerkerken has successfully deposed Swart from office and instigated a far more extremist brand of ideology upon the Netherlands. Surprisingly, this breath of fresh air appears to have gone down surprisingly well, particularly alongside convenient leaks of the secrets of various disgraced VNH loyalists.

name: Incorporate Landwacht into the Army
description: For too long the rightful spoils of governing have been left to weaker men within the VNH and the army. If things are to change, we must set about assimilating our loyal Landwacht fighters into the regular army at every level. We must entrench our control over lesser fools.

name: Voor Leider en Vaderland!
description: The cry goes out, 'for leader and fatherland!'. It booms from the rafters of the highest Amsterdam tower to the base of its lowest canal. Our new order is finally ready, and we are on the march. Voor Leider. Voor Vaderland.

name: Outlaw Trade Unions
description: The trade unions, those bastions of syndicalist ideology, pose an existential threat to our nation. By bringing in legislation that challenges the power of the trade unions enough to essentially consign them to history, we can end their despicable influence.

name: Staatsvakbond
description: The Dutch people have a newfound sense of pride, however with the loss of traditional pillars and outlets such as the unions, their anger and zeal might be directed our way. By instituting new state-led trade unions, we can diffuse and disarm these feelings, and potentially redirect them towards our enemies.

name: Amend the Ambtenarenverbod
description: The civil service ban has proven to be insufficient for protecting our fragile political system from subversion. By amending the legislation behind it to weigh it further in our favour, we can weaken the grasp of leftist groups over the apparatus of state.

name: Compulsory Anthem in Schools
description: As part of a wider systematic policy to encourage nationalist fervour in the country in the face of leftist opposition, a proposal has been put forward of some interest; ensure that the national anthem, the Het Wilhelmus, is compulsory in school classrooms.

name: Subvert the Legal System
description: Dangerous times call for desperate measures. Though it pains the conservative element in our government dearly, it is vital that government influence over the nation's legal system and judiciary be extended to allow us to tackle the threats facing us.

name: New Flag Protocol
description: One simple manner by which we can rekindle the spark of Dutch pride in our countrymen is to codify a new flag protocol. New rules governing how to treat the national flag, including its waving, its treatment and criminal penalties for mistreatment, would all be cheap yet popular.

name: Nationalist Renaissance
description: It doesn't take much to make a Dutchman love their country, it is an easy land to love after all. All the same, it is impressive how fast a few simple policies have managed to unite vast numbers of people around our country's political future.

name: CNA's Gamble Pays Off
description: The ruling CNA has managed to score yet another electoral victory, continuing its unopposed rule of the nation. All the same, its majority has shrunk, and it may have to find a coalition partner to continue with the authority and mandate it once had. Still, the status quo remains - for now.

name: CNA Rules Alone
description: We do not need any other. Holland has only one guiding hand, and it will continue to preserve society until its dying breath, God willing.

name: Tighten the Ambtenarenverbod
description: The civil service ban has been insufficient in its goal of stemming the tide of extremist influence within our government and administration. We must legislate to make it more effective at snuffing out dangerous ideologies.

name: Ban Paramilitary Groups
description: On both the left and right paramilitaries such as the Red Front and Landwacht have caused us disconcerting amounts of problems. This will end. Now.

name: Suppress the Paramilitaries
description: While we have implemented law banning paramilitary organisations, the time has come to truly enforce them. By cracking down hard on these undemocratic groups, we will strike a blow that will send the radicals scurrying back to their foreign paymasters. The security of the Netherlands depends on it.

name: NAS Dissolution
description: Outlawing the primary syndicalist party in the Netherlands is critical if our efforts are to have any chance of succeeding. Inspired by Communard French demagogues, this movement is a menace to all Dutch society.

name: Outlaw the RSAP
description: While the radical socialists are not quite as dangerous as other, more extreme left-wing groups, they are a danger to society. Their programmes and manifesto are persuasive to a number of lower-class workers and intellectuals, making them a key target.

name: Ban the Patriotten
description: The Patriotten are a virulent disease, the likes of which the Netherlands hasn't seen for many years. It is so radical that it poses as much as threat to other syndicalist ideologies as our own. Self-destructive impulses aside, we must suppress such groups.

name: Ban the VNH
description: With the left pushed underground, it becomes increasingly important that we crush the far-right threat in this country once and for all. The VNH's more extreme elements turn an otherwise palatable group into a potential danger to the nation, and as such they must be brought down by law.

name: Launch Underground Raids
description: With many extremist groups forced underground, that leaves them with only one remaining place for us to target. We will launch a major police operation and bring down the remnants of these hateful groups, no matter the cost.

name: Stable Once More!
description: It has been a hard road, but with our serious ideological opposition now consigned to prison cells, foreign shores or an early grave, perhaps now the Netherlands might be able to rest easy.

name: Entrench Pillarisation
description: The pillars are the foundation upon which Dutch society stands. Without them there can be no stability. At every opportunity we must embrace and bolster our cultural and democratic institutions.

name: Support the Pillars
description: We have begun implementing substantive acts and proposals intended to bolster the traditional pillars of Dutch society, for example through incentivising church attendance and encouraging Dutch footballers to travel for games overseas to the adulation of radio listeners.

name: The Pillars Preserved
description: Our efforts to inspire confidence in the traditional pillars have not gone unnoticed, and increasingly members of the public are coming to recognise the righteousness of our intervention in otherwise off-limit cultural and social affairs. Our actions are paying off.

name: Work With the LSP
description: If we have to work with others, then we could do no worse than the market liberal LSP. While our beliefs are primarily social, theirs tend to stress economic concerns. It is a compromise that does not pose too many problems, at least in comparison to our other 'choices'.

name: Negotiate with the Left
description: If we are to ensure that politics in the Netherlands remains relatively unbesmirched by extremism, it is important that we consider negotiating with some of the more moderate elements of the left to ensure stability.

name: Limited Welfare
description: A number of limited welfare reforms and incentives might just be enough to get the leftist groups on side. The question is whether or not they are acceptable to all involved.

name: De-Facto Recognition of Syndicalists
description: A number of leftists regularly demand that we recognise syndicalist regimes such as that of the Commune of France. While de-jure recognition is unpalatable to many rightist groups, if not totally out of the question, perhaps token recognition could be proposed.

name: Protection from the Landwacht
description: The Landwacht are a distinctly nationalist group of paramilitaries that regularly cause serious harm to left-wing activists and street marchers. No doubt the negotiations will centre on us assisting the leftists against them in some manner.

name: Restrict the Red Front
description: The left-wing Red Front paramilitaries pose a serious threat to civil order in our nation. We must demand some level of action be taken on them.

name: Limit the NAS
description: It is vital that we demand that at least some measures be taken against the NAS, a union of orthodox syndicalists that have the most moral legitimacy of most hard-left groups in the country. The question is, how far should we go in our demands?

name: Minimise Socialist Influence
description: One area that is critical for us is to limit the power of the radical socialist RSAP, the only hard-left group with parliamentary representation. They have a been a major thorn in our side, and so the negotiations would be a good chance of removing them.

name: Negotiations Succeeded!
description: Our willingness to concede on a few points, and the surprising willingness of our political rivals to come to terms, means that the negotiations have proven to be a relative success for all involved.

name: Cordon Sanitaire Against the Right
description: With the power of the leftists limited to a reasonable extent by our negotiations, it is time for us to unite against the forces of far-right extremism within the Netherlands.

name: Negotiate with the Right
description: Though it might not be an ideal situation, we would be best placed to negotiate with less extremist elements of the nationalist VNH movement in order to bring some measure of peace to Dutch politics.

name: Limit Landwacht Activities
description: A key part of the deal rests on the Landwacht, the right-wing VNH paramilitary group responsible for breaking leftist skulls in recent street marches. While we could demand that they be dissolved, pushing the point too hard might alienate even some relatively moderate VNH members.

name: Reduce Military Influence
description: A number of senior army figures are public members of the VNH, even if less politically noxious than others. All the same, we must make limiting the VNH's influence on our armed forces contingent on any deal we sign with them. We cannot allow the risk of a coup.

name: Limit Populist Parties
description: One demand that we must make of the VNH is to consider their position on allowing constant party rallies. At these rallies, a number of young Dutchmen are being radicalised by more extremist elements within the VNH.

name: Curtail Union Rights
description: If there is one thing that we can all agree on, it is that the threat posed by syndicalism and its trade union backers is existential. However, the VNH's demands that we seriously damage them might prove to be destabilising anathema to the Dutch working class.

name: Lower Tariffs
description: The VNH has demanded that we lower economic tariffs on imported goods, somewhat contrary to their nationalist leanings. While doing so might gain their support, it may prove to be unpopular with the people once cheap goods flood onto the market undercutting local businesses.

name: Nationalise German Assets
description: Unbelievably, one of the VNH's demands is that we seize German property in the country. Though this might be incredibly dangerous, the VNH have made it a major demand, and as such we cannot simply ignore it.

name: Negotiations Succeeded!
description: It appears that the more moderate wing of the VNH were not so unreasonable after all. With their support in neutralising the threat from the far-right elements within the nationalist movement, we can now turn our attention to promoting peace throughout the Dutch political system.

name: Cordon Sanitaire Against the Left
description: It is all in place now. With support from moderate and right groups, we can stem the malign influence of radical left groups within our proud nation. It seems that finally the Netherlands will be stable once more.

name: Dutch Democracy is Saved!
description: After months of brutal negotiations it appears that some level of stability is finally returning to Dutch politics.

name: Left List is Victorious
description: The moderate left of Dutch politics has won the recent elections, granting them the initiative and political capital needed to form a new government.

name: SDAP-RSAP Coalition
description: The more centrist social democrats have formed a coalition with the radical socialists in order to be able to put their views into effect in full.

name: Use the Popular Mandate
description: The people have given us their trust to repair the nation. With them having been granted their wish, we should work within the system to reform it.

name: Overthrow the System!
description: The parliamentary system of the Netherlands is obsolete! Let us abolish the current system in favour of a more radical solution.

name: Revoke the Ambtenarenverbod
description: The Ambtenarenverbod was a flawed attempt by Colijn to stop the rise of syndicalism in the Netherlands. With a serious left-wing coalition in power, it is time for us to repeal this obsolete mess!

name: Institute a Minimum Wage
description: Many people are currently working for less than they need for survival. Let us implement a general minimum wage that provides a safety net to those most in need...

name: Ban the VNH
description: The VNH is a highly polarising force within Dutch politics. The country is better off without their corrosive influence.

name: Disperse the Far-Right
description: Through our measures the far right has been virtually expunged from our nation. It will take years for them to become a significant force again even if we were to stop now! All the same, we must keep up the relentless pressure.

name: VDB-SDAP Coalition
description: The social democrats must work with their partners in the Lijst Links electoral alliance if they are to set up the first Dutch centre-left government.

name: Amend the Wapenwet
description: Currently weapons are quite easily obtainable in the Netherlands, a serious concern in these politically turbulent times. If we were to tighten up our weapons legislation, it would help us limit the casualties of civil violence.

name: Dissolve the Landwacht
description: The paramilitary wing of the VNH is infamous for terrorising peaceful demonstrations, breaking up strikes by force, and allegedly even committing political assassinations! They ought to be banned!

name: Dissolve the Red Front
description: The paramilitary National Red Front is a threat to public order, renowned for its street brawling, persecution of businessmen and supposed violence against the Church! We must outlaw them if we are to get stability!

name: Demand That the Violence Cease
description: In spite of our ban on paramilitaries roaming our streets the violence has only marginally declined. It is time that we invite the leadership of both sides to a meeting to demand their assistance in resolving this crisis.

name: Doorbraak
description: For too long Holland's political system has been fragmented into clusters of self-serving interest groups and institutions. No more! Finally, we shall shatter the obsolete pillars of the past by implementing a new depillarisation programme.

name: Entice Christian Progressives
description: Many Christian progressives vote for the conservatives simply because they are Christian. Part of the Doorbraak policy will be incentivising them to actually vote for the left-wing parties that they secretly admire.

name: The United State
description: We ought to show unity at all times. Let us stand united as Dutchmen versus the world.

name: Democratic Collectivisation
description: Let us collectivise private property where we can, so that every Dutch citizen can be equally represented in the Netherlands of the future.

name: Close Pillar Institutions
description: It is time we end this pillarised society. Someone who is Protestant will only listen to Protestant radio as it is. Let us end these rifts by closing down the Catholic, Liberal, Protestant and even Socialist news media!

name: National Dutch Broadcaster
description: With the closure of all major broadcasting stations as part of our depillarisation efforts, it is time for us to launch one station for all Dutch, one that represents us all!

name: Progressive Tax System
description: We are to tax the rich more than the poor if we are to be able to fund the welfare state we are envisioning and increase equality, even if the rich will not like such a move.

name: State Pensions
description: An essential part of the new Dutch welfare state will be that the elderly will be able to retire with a minimum standard of living, thanks to the contribution of those that continue working.

name: Subsidised Tuition
description: Nothing helps social mobility more than making it possible for those with the capacity to receive the schooling they need. Henceforth the future will determine your fate instead of the past.

name: Sick Leave Legislation
description: Employers should allow people who are not well to stay home for some time, as it is the humane thing to do. Sadly, not everyone seems to agree, so we'll need to make it mandatory.

name: Mandatory Health Insurance
description: Currently healthy people of young age usually do not take health insurance, resulting in very expensive insurance, resulting in some people who need cover being unable to pay for it. We ought to make it mandatory.

name: Twinkling Social Democracy
description: Our policies have made the Netherlands a beacon in the world, and an example for all on how to build a proper welfare state.

name: The SDAP Question
description: With the Netherlands entering a new socio-political order, the time has come to consider whether to allow the somewhat centrist SDAP to stand for election to the assembly that will decide the nation's future. It may be a Trojan Horse for reactionaries.

name: Elect a New Assembly
description: We must choose who to elect to our new legislative body in order to establish a new constitutional framework for Holland.

name: The Third National Assembly
description: The time has come. The Assembly will decide on who fills each post within the new executive Volksraad, allowing all left-wing parties to have a say in this new political order.

name: One Raadspensionaris!
description: Unexpectedly, most of the Assembly appears to have come to one simple conclusion. There should only be a single 'Grand Pensionary', David Wijnkoop, who shall guard the revolution against reactionaries and imperialists without a shred of mercy.

name: Council of the State
description: The Council-Communists under Anton Pannekoek and his KAPN have taken a majority in the new Assembly, becoming the leading constituents of the Volksraad executive body. Known for their opposition to formal decision-making bodies, this has come as quite a shock.

name: Vakbondsfederatie
description: The Assembly's majority choice appeared to be the syndicalist NAS party under Jacques de Kadt, who has called for Communard-style rule under a 'federation of trade unions'. The most 'orthodox' of the serious leftist groups in the state, the NAS was a clear compromise between all involved.

name: Socialist Republic
description: Henk Sneevliet's radical socialist RSAP party has been elected with a majority by the Assembly as the new government. A new socialist republic is likely to be formed, with less of the overt posturing of the hard-left syndicalists and reactionary-style backsliding of the SDAP.

name: Social Democracy
description: Shocking many of those present in the Assembly, it appears that the Volksraad elected was indeed that of the moderate SDAP under Willem Albard. It appears that, for the other more militant factions of the revolution, allowing the SDAP to take part in the elections proved to be a serious mistake.

name: Rebuilding [HOL.GetNameDef]
description: With the [HOL.GetRulingPartylong] being voted via Third National Assembly to govern, they seek to rebuild [HOL.GetNameDef] from the ground up.

name: Proletarian Humanism
description: The [HOL.getrulingparty] supports syndicalism being introduced to [HOL.getname] at the pace of a sloth. They view men being different to the natural order of things, and as such should be treated so.

name: Revolutionary Vanguard
description: The revolution cannot wait; it needs to be pushed forward so workers of the world can unite under one banner. Break the chains!!!

name: Exercitiegenootschap
description: The revolution is far from assured. At every turn there is another threat that must be systematically eliminated to preserve what we have so far accomplished. Drawing from our history, we shall army those who are loyal to our ideals, to put down any who threat our revolution.

name: Enshrine Leninism
description: The now pasted Russian Marxist revolutionary Vladimir Lenin stated that the proletariat shall rise up against their capitalist enslavers and be the vanguard of the revolution. We shall follow in this great man's footsteps.

name: Labour Camps
description: Our political and ideological foes can learn peace through labour, by soldiering for the revolution in the mines and in the camps. There, disarmed, they can pose little threat to us and can reflect on their flawed beliefs and acts.

name: Factory Towns
description: To ensure the protection of the worker against the counter-reactionaries, we must ensure they are safe in their towns. Even if that means they cannot leave, especially those with a German background...

name: Review Union Laws
description: We must take note from [FRA.getname] who were at one point at the mercy of their own Unions, who has been directing the economy, via dishonesty, and near capitalist means. We will tighten our measures to ensure this does not occur within our small nation.

name: Democratic Workplaces
description: All workers must have a say in the company for which they slave. No longer shall employers and reactionaries oppress those that toil for them - without representation at least.

name: Market Syndicalism
description: Just because there is a new leftist order in Holland doesn't mean that we should cast aside all of our old trappings. After all, the markets incentivise workers in many fields, including construction.

name: Verzorgingsstaat
description: The least we owe our people is a well-managed and properly functioning Welfare State, one that is palatable to both socialists and conservatives alike.

name: Union Liberty Constitution
description: Formalising the new political order of our nation with a formal constitution would alleviate the concerns of many, more conservative Dutchmen as well as legitimise our executive in its new role.

name: Industrial Democracy
description: No more shall the few make decisions for the many. Our workers shall be more involved in the making of decisions, sharing responsibilities, and authority within the workplace.

name: Industrial Syndicalism
description: The Netherlands, thanks to the exploitation of the worker, and their colonial slaves, has become a centre of industrialisation. Now with the proletariat in charge, we are able to right the wrongs of the Capitalist and ensure the rights of the worker is put first.

name: Rebuilding the Bureaucracy
description: The stain of the previous administration will take years to completely remove. Though we make steps to purge ourselves of their capitalist bureaucracy and replace it with one that cares for the worker.

name: Mass Collectivisation
description: A key part of our economic doctrine is the collectivisation of agriculture and industry, lumping smaller entities under a larger and more efficient centre.

name: Socialist Economic Planning
description: With the ability to now plan the economy to that of the worker will allow the government to dictate development with them in mind first, and not profit.

name: Mixed Economy
description: Under the [HOL.GetRulingParty], private and state ran companies work in tandem, to ensure that the workers, and the reactionaries are put first.

name: Finish the National Assembly
description: With a number of substantial reforms instigated and proposals outlined, the Assembly now appears to be drawing to a relatively close, its primary purpose served. It has been invaluable in drawing our new socio-political system together and so its legacy will live on.

name: Batavian Committee of Science
description: By nationalising the assets of research companies and placing them under the oversight of one committee by, for and with the people, we will be able to conduct research far more efficiently.

name: Defending the Revolution
description: As a syndicalist nation in Europe it is vital that we play our part in the struggle for the working class. To do otherwise would be a gross dereliction of our duty.

name: Men from R.E.D
description: The Men from R.E.D 'Revolutionary Exportation Directory' have been working from the shadows for years, evading the capitalists' GS III agency, and assisting with the revolution. Now that the Proletariat have arisen, they have switched roles to assist us in rebuilding the Nederlander Volksleger (NV).

name: Arms of the Proletariat
description: British arms are finding their way into the hands of Dutch Proletariat, who will drive the Prussians back.

name: De Bataafse Revolutie
description: Our history is rife with the Germans, and all the forms they take, attempting to rob us of our freedom. We shall ensure the Dutch Proletariat is aware of these facts, regardless how \"embellished\" they are.

name: De Rode Vesting
description: Reversing the defensive plans by Winkelman, will have our forts face the Germans, and not our comrades.

name: The People's Army
description: We have removed our Burgerlijk officers, and those that sympathetic to their cause. We are now truly now an army for the people.

name: British Pantser Designs
description: A gap has been left in our army in the execution of armoured warfare tactics, and tank designs. Though with British designs, and Dutch ingenuity, we the Dutch are seeking to bridge this gap.

name: CS 6
description: The CS 6 was formed under the auspices of R.E.D agents, with the origin of its name lost. Its goal is to help preserve syndicalist ideology within [HOL.getname].. by any means

name: Prepare the Inundation Lines
description: Ever since our independence war against the Spanish in the 16th century, inundation, or intentional flooding of the land, has been an integral part of our defences. Properly prepared, it will surely save us again: we have yet to see a tank that can cross water.

name: Red Sky Initiative
description: Though we are a nation of traders, and builders, our population is much smaller than those that are at the gates. We shall use shells not men to keep the enemies back, with our proud worker providing them at a steady pace.

name: Paratroepen
description: Brute force isn't required against our enemy, but precision, which our newly formed Paratroopers can provide.

name: A New Navy
description: Class Traitors, Reactionaries, Verraders. These are the names given to those who serve in Burgerlijk fleet, who are now cowering in [DEI.Getname]. They have left us with nothing, though we shall rebuild...

name: A New Direction
description: Though we lack a fleet, we have the facilities to build more. Though building Battleships, or Dreadnoughts is not within our means, a new direction has been sort.

name: Radical Approach
description: The cost benefit analysis to build new Battleships, and Pantserschip has shown that they are outdated as they leave the shipwrights. A bold, new radical approach would see \"Vlootplan Furstner\" reviewed, and implemented for our Navy.

name: Rocket Development
description: Furthering our Red Sky Initiative - Rockets and similar ordnance are being researched and constructed to rain down upon our enemies.

name: Volk Luchtmacht
description: With many of our previous members of the Luchtmacht leaving, like our navy, we have been forced to start from scratch. Our only saving grace is they left the planes behind for us...

name: Smash the Pillars of Capitalisms
description: As we smashed the pillars within our society, we must smash the pillars of capitalism. With our new arsenal, we shall do just that.

name: Aftermath of Black Monday
description: Black Monday shockwaves have hit the Dutch economy hard. The government will be forced to take immediate and drastic action to avoid the economy breaking down completely.

name: Plan for Labour
description: Het Plan van de Arbeid, or 'Plan for labour' is a social-democratic strategy to deal with the fallout of Black Monday by committing to large public works and government spending in order to combat rising unemployment.

name: Public Works
description: By investing in public projects like the construction of canals, city parks and highways, we will be able to restore the purchasing power of the common man, who would otherwise be unemployed, while also getting improved infrastructure in return.

name: Extend Unemployment Subsidies
description: Owing to Black Monday, more people are unemployed than ever before. While the conservative and especially the liberal governments of the last decades have implemented basic unemployment subsidies, they were afraid to discourage working if they made the rates too high; couple that with inflation and everyone living of these subsidies is impossible.

name: Finish Rijksweg 12
description: During the German golden age under Tirpitz, plans for building a highway connecting The Hague with the German border were already considered, though it ended up only reaching as far as Oudenrijn. Extending the Rijksweg to the German border would serve as a powerful symbol of our government's commitment to other national infrastructure projects.

name: Limited Working Week
description: The minimum working week is too long, and as a result, employers cannot afford to hire as many as they otherwise could. By shortening the working week, employers will be forced to hire more people, thus allowing more people to earn a living.

name: Improve the Afsluitdijk
description: The Afsluitdijk was finished in the early thirties and closes off the Zuiderzee, turning the IJsselmeer into an inland bay. The risk of the dike breaking could have disastrous effects however, so investing in securing its structural integrity could hardly hurt. Furthermore, it would also deliver much-needed work for unemployed people.

name: Privatisation of Projects
description: Our investments have borne fruit: companies are expressing their interest in taking over some of our national projects in hopes of making a profit off them. To do this, they will need to hire people, who will in turn spend more money. While we have not fully recovered from Black Monday yet, this will surely be the beginning of the end of our nation's suffering.

name: Implement a Monetarist Approach
description: Socialists and Conservatives alike call us mad, but the best approach is not to intervene directly and let the market fix itself while we help by devaluing the Guilder and opening up more opportunities for our import-export sector, the beating heart of our economy.

name: Drop the Gold Standard
description: We adhere to the Gold Standard so that investors will see the Guilder as a stable currency that can always be turned in for gold at the central bank. An unfortunate side-effect of having a strong Guilder is that it makes it expensive for people from other countries to purchase Dutch products. By dropping the gold standard and devaluing the Guilder we can mitigate these effects.

name: Trade Missions
description: Trade missions seeking to reach agreement with foreign governments and companies are a great way to expand the reach of Dutch business and potentially alleviate the current economic downturn.

name: West Indies Trade Hub
description: The West Indies are ideally situated to be a trading post for trade with the western hemisphere. The America's, far away from Germany's sphere of influence, can also provide a chance to diversify our exports, which is currently overly focussed on the Kaiserreich.

name: Loan to Shell
description: Royal Dutch Shell has been through a series of rough years during the 1920s. While other Dutch companies prospered, Shell suffered the catastrophic loss of their British holdings in the Revolution of 1925, a situation only alleviated by our accession to the German economic sphere of the Reichspakt. We can give them a loan that will surely turn into an investment beneficial for both parties.

name: Loan to SBM
description: The Surinaamse Bauxiet Maatschappij is a mining company in Dutch Guyana. By giving them a loan, they will be able to expand their activities on the South American continent and hopefully deliver us more military-critical resources than ever before.

name: Return to Pre-Crisis Export Rates
description: Our efforts to make Dutch companies as lucrative as possible have borne fruit: export rates are returning to pre-crisis levels, and in some sectors even exceed these levels. To handle the workload, companies are forced to hire more people, resulting in more spending power for the common man. While this may not amount to full recovery yet, it is possible to see a bright horizon ahead of us.

name: Werkfonds
description: The best way to work ourselves out of the Black Monday malaise will be by keeping the government balance positive and the Guilder strong. In turn, we can invest the excess money saved into public works projects, but contrary to the social-democratic plan, without forcing gargantuan debts upon our beleaguered treasury.

name: Werkverschaffing
description: To combat the crisis of rampant unemployment unleashed by Black Monday, the government has decided to expand its labour programme.

name: Cut Employment Benefits
description: More and more people are sacked from their workplace, and the treasury is increasingly stretched by their demand for subsidies and benefits. If we are not to end up with a monstrous debt at the end of this, we must cut down the money available.

name: Cut Employers' Red Tape
description: One of the factors that pushes Dutch industry behind foreign competition is our raft of highly sophisticated yet burdensome safety regulation. It's sad, but we cannot afford such things in these times of crisis.

name: A Country of Canals
description: By building canals all over the Netherlands we will keep our unemployed populace working while rejuvenated businesses will profit from the canals and the infrastructure it brings in the future.

name: A Park for Every Town
description: Another manner to keep our unemployed busy is by building a lot of parks. Generations yet unborn will be able to come to their senses in these tranquil sites, that will have been built in these hard times.

name: Unemployment Reduced
description: Our werkverschaffing-programme has borne fruit: day after day, less people come to stamp as proof that they are in fact unemployed and not claiming their subsidies as free extra money on top of their regular salary. It seems we succeeded, and while we have not fully recovered yet from Black Monday, the worst of the crisis' effects seem to have abated.

name: National Recovery
description: Plutocratic incompetency has resulted in the collapse of our economy. At the same time, the world becomes increasingly unsafe. If we invest fully in the defensive and offensive capabilities of our country that too will help the economy grow again, but then with construction that will actually help our country's security in the future.

name: Defence Spending Spree
description: We shall bring our military back to the level of the rest of the world. Socialists and other unpatriotic folk are saying that the military should be the last place the government should invest in these times, but we shall prove them wrong!

name: Factory Building
description: By building more factories the nation will be able to increase its domestic military production. While we are a transit country it can never hurt to invest in other sectors as well.

name: Forced Labour Draft
description: Many so-called unemployed claims they cannot find work to do; at the same time, we cannot find people to defend the fatherland. This paradoxical situation will end now. If you want to receive money from the state then you will have to do something for it if you can, even if it will mean that our soldiers will be slightly less motivated.

name: The Rhine Line
description: Ever since the inception of the Communard regime in France the godless syndicalists have been plotting our destruction and that of our German neighbour. The Rhine is a significant obstacle to this end and if we were to strengthen it with forts, provided God blesses us, there will be no foreign syndicalist setting foot on Dutch soil north of the Rhine.

name: Media Censorship
description: We cannot just trust the intellect of the common man, and need to those block dirty syndicalists where we can. By censoring most French media, and limited censorship of known syndicalist affiliated media, will dam these muddy waters.

name: More Purchasing Power
description: Our large investments in the military are resulting in people finding work across a number of sectors, ranging from the production of weapons to serving in the army themselves. As a result, they have money to spend, which is now slowly kickstarting the recovery of other sectors as well. While we have not fully recovered from Black Monday yet, we are certain that this is the beginning of the end of the suffering.

name: Recovery from Black Monday
description: Our sound strategy to fight the economic collapse that ensued after Black Monday has resulted in the stabilisation of our economy. In all sectors, more people are employed, more products are sold and increasing liquidity is floating around. It seems we succeeded in guiding the country through a hard time, and people are confident in the future once again.

name: Repay Government Debts
description: It is an unfortunate fact of life that money does not grow on trees, and the government has been forced to issue a number of bonds and requested loans from foreign investors to fill the void. It is imperative that we pay these debts off sooner rather than later.

name: Control Inflation
description: With inflation still uncomfortably high because of the Black Monday, we must enact deflationary measures to get it under control. For example, by demanding that bank reserve rates be increased so that they are forced to hold onto more capital. Such actions will help stop our freshly rescued economy from overheating.

name: Restore Pre-Crisis Regulations
description: The somewhat brutal policies of the Black Monday years have served their purpose well, incentivising business and getting government spending. All the same, it is vital that we restore our nation's lost confidence by restoring some of their long-deserved privileges.

name: Economic Boom
description: With just the right amount of interference and hands-off approach, our economy has become less a shadow of its former self, than an outright phoenix. Holland is standing strong, and our nation is booming.

name: Eastern Industrialisation
description: Imports from Germany and the borderlands are the future. By investing in that region, we shall be able to benefit from cross-border trade and encourage a number of new businesses to open.

name: Northern Industrialisation
description: We have already established funds to help businesses in the north of the country. All that remains for us to do now is to open it up to applications.

name: Consolidate the Arms Industry
description: Our recent efforts to incentivise small businesses are already paying off, particularly in the domestic sphere. All the same, it is vital now that we encourage a number of small military firms to come together to enable them to make a meaningful contribution to our military sector.

name: Subsidise Philips
description: Philips is one of our most famous corporations, and a global player in the electronics market. By subsidising their R&D and engaging in joint ventures with them, we can harness them for our own state uses.

name: Investments in Spyker
description: Though Spyker has had its ups and downs, its military value makes it a key player in our country. By investing in a majority shareholding in the firm we would be able to take advantage of its automotive prowess to develop mechanised technology.

name: Werkspoor Loans
description: The Werkspoor company is our primary armour designer, and as such we should not overlook its importance as a potential driver for improving our army's potential in the near future.

name: The Dutch Army
description: The Netherlands does not need anyone to tell them about how to manage an effective military. All the same, with the fell winds of conflict on the horizon, it is important that we give greater thought to the long-term future of our army.

name: Expand the GS III
description: Third Department of the General Staff was established during the early days of the Weltkrieg. Its goal was to ensure monitor both the Central Powers, or the Entente, to provide insight in the goings-on, and to ensure no ill will was to be directed at the Netherlands. Now with Radicalism on the rise, the GS III has been called on again to defend the Netherlands from enemies that are both foreign and domestic...

name: Rifles and Boots
description: Our infantrymen are the bedrock on which our army is based. We must give them all of the support we can so that they aren't forced to march into battle with little more than broomsticks and sandals.

name: Koninklijke Militaire Academie
description: The Royal Military Academy (KAM) has been supplying the Army, and the Marechaussee (National Police) with fresh commissioned officers since 1828. With the Weltkrieg over, and with many officers on both sides of the conflict now retiring. We should seek them to impart their knowledge, and experiences on our cadets, to better them.

name: Focus on Defence
description: Our land is a brutal morass, a place of swamps, marshes and sturdy men. By playing to the Netherlands' strengths, we shall make our enemies bleed for every inch they take.

name: Expand the Artillerie Inrichtingen
description: The Koninklijke Artillerie Inrichtingen are vital for our army. We need to reopen production lines so we can start replacing our old equipment with modern materiel.

name: New Anti-Tank Guns
description: If we are to hold out against a superior foe, we need weapons capable of penetrating even the mightiest of Panzers. We must invest into anti-tank weaponry and its research.

name: Artillery Modernisation
description: Our defensive measures have no use if we have no big guns to back them up. And these guns from the 19th century we have now will make nice museum pieces.

name: Regiment Stoottroepen
description: The infiltration tactics used by the German army in the Weltkrieg, have made their way into the Dutch army with the expansion of a shock troop regiment.

name: Anti-Aircraft Guns
description: We cannot hope to match the superpowers in terms of aerial capabilities. We must invest in a network of defensive gun emplacements and flak towers.

name: Reinforce the Vesting Holland
description: Our defences should hold, but it would be foolish of us to hope that in their current state they would prove effective enough against invading armies. Further investment into our fortifications is paramount.

name: Study Defence Plans
description: As a small coastal nation, we have always anticipated attack from the sea, but new threats on the global stage are forcing us to deal with potential land invasions as well. We need to make better plans for the defence of the Netherlands.

name: Mobilisation Preparations
description: Revisiting our mobilisation timetables and preparations will allow us to be ready for war should the need arise.

name: Korps Pioniers
description: The Pioneer Corps are the jewel in our military crown. All the same, we must invest further time and energy into these men, if we are to make the most advantage from their talents.

name: Prepare the Inundation Lines
description: Ever since our independence war against the Spanish in the 16th century, inundation, or intentional flooding of the land, has been an integral part of our defences. Properly prepared, it will surely save us again: we have yet to see a tank that can cross water.

name: A Mobile Army
description: Our flat land makes mechanised and armoured divisions a no-brainer. By investing further into this area and applying new military doctrine to our army, the Netherlands can become a force to be reckoned with.

name: Bicycles For our Soldiers
description: We Dutch are famed for our bicycles. They grant the user a surprising level of mobility and have served our armies well for years. We need more. Many more.

name: Pantrado M39 Armoured Cars
description: Armoured Cars are a cheap and efficient way of scouting the battlefield and providing cheap transport for our troops. We need to extend our research into the design and production of better models.

name: Integrated Recon Battalions
description: More important than being able to fight, is knowing where your enemy is before they detect you. By integrating recon companies into our divisions, we shall give our forces a crucial edge.

name: The Gemotorizeerde Huzaren
description: While once horses were the choice of the cavalrymen of their day, we need new vehicles for a new breed of hussars to bring death to our enemies.

name: van Doorne's Aanhangwagen Fabriek
description: DAF Trucks are a vital part of an economy based on exports and have recently won a military contract to further expand the M39 fleet.

name: Genietroepen
description: The more moving parts in our Army, the more military engineers are required to keep it moving forward... or rolling in some cases.

name: Integrated Support Elements
description: With the integration of support elements, our forces can thurst deeper into enemy territory.

name: Study Mobile Tactics
description: We are now starting to get all this new and expensive machinery, but we have no experience actually using it! We should study the usage of mobile truck divisions and tanks otherwise it is all for nothing.

name: Braat Overvalwagen
description: Developed in the Dutch East Indies, the Braat Overvalwagen is cheap enough to make armoured personnel carrier. We can consider adopting this design for the mainland army as well.

name: Pantserkorps Formation
description: The people like to see that we are spending their tax money in new fields. By publicly demonstrating our resolve to form a new armoured force, we might just be able to win some kudos.

name: The Dutch Navy
description: As we move into an era beyond the Weltkrieg, we will need to decide how our navy develops. There are multiple plans on the table, we will have to evaluate each one and decide on the best.

name: Convoy Sailing
description: Properly organising our vulnerable transport ships with escort ships able to defend them from harm ensures they have a better chance of arriving at their destination.

name: Anti-Submarine Destroyer
description: By far the greatest danger to our merchant fleet is not via the air, nor the few odd commerce raiders about, but hiding underwater until it might be too late to act. We thus must outfit our destroyers with the latest Anti-Submarine equipment to deal with this threat.

name: Flotilla Leader
description: Large ships are expensive, and we shall never be able to build enough for our needs. It thus has been proposed to build a new class of ship, the 'flotilla leader'. Either a small cruiser or a large destroyer in size and thus comparatively cheap, packed with enough firepower to destroy enemy fast surface raiders and dangers lurking under water.

name: Gateway to Europe
description: Our ports have always seen the goods of the world flow through it, and onto mainland Europe. We shall expand upon our ports and drydocks in [36.GetCapitalVictoryPointName] to further expand our capital.

name: Vlootplan Doorman
description: The navy is crucial for our survival, and we will need all the firepower we can get. Having an assortment of smaller ships and outdated cruisers will not be enough, we must invest into proper cruisers and our battleship force.

name: Wilton Fijenoord
description: The NV Dok en Werf Maatschappij Wilton-Fijenoord is in Schiedam, west of Rotterdam. With its origins tracing back to the first half of the 19th century and was the first Dutch shipbuilding company to use steamer turbines. It is responsible for building most of the Dutch cruisers, as well as some destroyers and submarines.

name: Kijkduin Class Cruisers
description: Our previous cruiser designs are either old or just outgunned and too thinly armoured. It is time the Dutch navy gets some truly modern cruisers to form the backbone of the navy.

name: A New Pantserschip
description: Our old armoured cruisers are either rusting away at the docks or converted to other uses. We can study reviving this type of ship as they can be used as capable coastal defence ships or cruiser killers, or simply as a cheaper alternative to expensive battleships.

name: Our Battleships
description: Our five Battleships were constructed during the 1920s. While we lack the knowledge to build such majestic ships from the ground up, we can refit them to improve their capabilities, or ask German ship wharfs to come up with new designs for us.

name: Capital Ship Training
description: The new large-scale ships we are building will necessitate a lot of new training for the crew, and there are a lot of crew as well! We need to implement a new training regimen for all the new sailors needed by this large ocean-spanning fleet.

name: Vlootplan Helfrich
description: We simply do not possess the means to compete with Japan or any other major navy on the surface waters, hence Admiral Helfrich proposes that we outfit our navy with the ships we can also build best, submarines, and harass enemy mercantile shipping and troop transports while we protect our own!

name: Rotterdamsche Droogdok Maatschappij
description: The Rotterdamsche Droogdok Maatschappij has a dedicated submarine wharf which host talented engineers to provide us with the latest submarine designs and innovations. Furthermore, smaller surface ships can also be built at the shipyard, giving us exactly the ships we need... and can afford.

name: Ship a Day Tactics
description: Our submarines are high in quality, but low in quantity compared to other major seafaring nations. We thus must use each one at its fullest. Admiral Helfrich intends to push every submarine and crew to its limits by aggressively sailing out, and by using unconventional tactics as diving into enemy harbours and torpedoing everything in sight.

name: Wolfpack
description: Our submarines should form small groups so they can pick of multiple targets. Should this 'wolfpack' be detected though, this could also mean that multiple submarines cannot escape safely...

name: Independent Operations
description: Our submarines should always operate separately in a spread-out manner. This reduces the damage potential of a successful raid, but also makes them harder to detect and might force the enemy to spread-out.

name: O Class Submarines
description: Our submarines are going to be designed mainly for operation in the Atlantic. We need them to be stealthy and hit hard to be able to compete with naval powers like Germany, the Commune of France, and the Union of Britain.

name: K Class colonial submarines
description: Our empire stretches far, so our submarines need to reach far. We thus need replacement for our ageing colonial submarines, and we need more of them!

name: Vlootplan Furstner
description: We must radically alter our navy's composition. It is being made increasingly clear that battleships are being made redundant by the ever-improving potency of the airplane. We need to expand on our existing carrier and her capabilities, and if possible, acquire more naval airpower!

name: Koninklijke de Schelde
description: The area around Vlissingen is perfect for our new shipyard expansion. First built in 1875, it has traditionally focused on repair and resupply, but it's high time we made it into a large construction area as well.

name: Escort Destroyer
description: Our carrier and other capital ships are slow lumbering targets and can easily be torpedoed if left unguarded. We need to ensure that our destroyers are up for that task.

name: Anti-Aircraft Light Cruiser
description: We need ships to shoot enemy planes out of the skies to protect our fleet. A cruiser sized design is perfect for that. We can specialise our future cruiser designs to have less guns pointing at the sea, and more into the skies!

name: Carrier Tactics
description: We have a carrier force, but never properly studied how to use them effectively. We should remedy this at once.

name: The Gouden Leeuw
description: The HrMs Gouden Leeuw is truly the pride of our navy. The lone carrier gives us a massive boost in our capabilities, but other navies have more and bigger carriers than her. We can press her to the limit and try to get more planes in the hangar, or we can attempt to get a new one!

name: The Dutch Air Force
description: Airpower has already shown to be useful in the Weltkrieg, and we can only anticipate its need increasing. We need to lay a firm foundation for airpower in the Netherlands to keep up with foreign enemies.

name: KAM Air Academie
description: The Air Force is still lacking an organised education system for pilots and officers alike. By setting up the Luchtvaartacademie (Air Academy) within the Royal Military Academy we can improve the tactical operations of the air force considerably.

name: Gilze-Rijen Air Base
description: The LVA only has one proper airbase for military use, Airbase Soesterberg. Although centrally located, storing all our airplanes is not ideal. Developing the already existing airstrip at Gilze-Rijen will give our air force an additional base.

name: Koolhoven
description: Koolhoven Vliegtuigen Fabriek N.V. situated in Rotterdam, has delivered some smaller airplane types for our air force in the past, mostly trainer planes. However, Koolhoven shows potential, and we can consider giving them a chance to supply our air force with much needed modern planes.

name: Koolhoven Naval Bombers
description: Airplanes with torpedoes attached are the bane of any ship, especially the big and lumbering ones. Koolhoven has a rough concept of a promising twin-engine naval bomber design, which are perfect for patrolling near the coast for enemy shipping.

name: Carrier Plane Variants
description: The Gouden Leeuw is useless without proper planes, and she is starting to become so with her biplanes in her hanger. Koolhoven has offered us some designs which can be quickly adopted for carrier usage.

name: Koolhoven Fighters
description: As we have opted for Koolhoven as our chief designer for the air force, we should start with replacing our antiquated fighter force with new planes from Koolhoven.

name: Fokker
description: Fokker, situated in Amsterdam, has long been a dominant force in the civil aviation market. We should take the designs and adopt them for military use, lending our fighter craft extended range, agility, and firepower.

name: Fokker Fighters
description: The Fokker D.XVII forms the bulk of our fighter squadrons, and it has served well as a sturdy and agile machine. Now it is time for a replacement suitable for our needs, and who can do that better than Fokker!

name: Fokker Jachtkruisers
description: A twin-engine fighter might not be as fast and nimble, yet the proposed 'Jachtkruisers' by Fokker carry a deadly pack of machineguns, have a much longer range and can potentially be equipped with a bomb load of their own, making them versatile planes.

name: Finish Ontwerp 115 Bomber
description: Fokker has design plans in an advanced stage for a true four-four-engine bomber. We can order a prototype to be built and then see if we will actually build this behemoth for our air force.

name: A New Bomber
description: The LVA needs a new bomber as those in service are not particularly modern, or even useful. However, but we lack the capacity to have multiple types and should pick one suitable for our needs. Quick and nimble close air support planes, or continue with the Luchtkruiser twin-engine bomber concept?

name: Huisje-Boompje-Beestje Tactics
description: By flying very low, our relatively slow bombers are considerably harder to detect and thus have a higher chance to reach their target. Unless they hit a tree of course...

name: Luchtkruiser Tactics
description: Our twin-engine planes are not just simple bombers, with their 20mm cannon installed in the nose installed they are like the cruisers of the air! They might not be fast, but can be a serious threat to other bombers, as well as enemy fighters who decide to attack them frontally!
